review: I've been on Clindamycin, multiple times 450mg every 8 hours for 7 days. 300mg every 8 hours for 7 days. 300mg every 12 hours for 10 days. Knocks out MRSA cellulitis/folliculitis like no other. A combo of Keflex and Doxy for 20 days did nothing except land me in the ER with MRSA sepsis, where IV Clindamycin took care of it in 24 hours. I now ask for it by name. It's going to work, trust me. Side effects for me personally are body/joint aches, tiredness and a bit of brain fog. Extreme nausea and reflux occurred the first time I took it, until I learned to only drink water while taking it. Cut out everything else you drink, especially carbonated drinks, and stick to water.

I have taken Clindamycin close to 8 times now for infected teeth, gum abscesses & full blown MRSA & it has been the only antibiotic that has done the job. I’d also like to mention for any of those reading this, I suffer from severe emetophobia. I’ve been on the highest dose as well as the lowest & as long as I drink TONS of water, DO NOT lie down for a solid 30-45 mins, take a probiotic & keep eating small meals I have minimal side effects with this antibiotic. That’s not to say I don’t experience the occasional stomach discomfort, weird taste in my mouth, brain fog, dizziness but it also depends on what I’m being treated for & how bad that infection is to begin with. A dose of this & a shot of Toradol in the ER knocked my 10/10 tooth/jaw pain down to a 2/10 within 10 minutes as I refuse any narcotics. This medication may not be everyone’s cup of tea but if you have a severe infection that is at risk of spreading I highly recommended giving it a shot.
This caused c. Diff for my Mom, a horrible disease. Don't take this Ever!!

I have had to take this for a dental abscess several times since I cannot take amoxicillin.Most recently my dentist gave me a loading dose of 600 mg and then 300 mg 3x a day. Each time I have not been able to tolerate and it was switched to 150 mg 3x a day.On the plus side, it definitely worked for my infection each time.I didn't realize until looking back at my emails that this medication has consistently made me race mentally and have very bad insomnia. I actually have become what I would call manic, but not manic in a "fun" way but racing in a bad way. And I do not have mania as a diagnosis. I do have anxiety, however. But this feels different from having anxiety.The other side effect I get from it is a very tight chest after taking it, which may be related to the reflux other people experience with it.In my experience, there aren't any great antibiotics without side effects, which is why I will give this a middle of the road score.
